description:
POSITION: Vice President, Business Development

DEPARTMENT: Business Development, Americas

FLSA STATUS: Salaried Exempt

Summary

As the world's leading venue management company and producer of live event experiences, ASM Global is the preeminent management and content partner with over 350 venues worldwide. Operating and investing in the world's most important stadiums, arenas, convention centers, and theaters requires unmatched dedication and the most profound expertise. Our focus is YOU! Through investments in growth, resources, and technology we strive to enhance the experience of our internal Team Members and to continue creating amazing live experiences for the guests that we serve.

ASM Global has an excellent and immediate opening for the Vice President, Business Development. This position represents ASM Global in all aspects of new business development by identifying new prospective clients, acquisitions, and new strategic business opportunities. He/she will initiate new business outreach, present ASM Global capabilities, develop compelling partnership proposals, presentations, and financials, create RFP responses, and lead contract negotiations. The Vice President of Business Development will be responsible for working with departments across the organization to identify, develop, plan, and implement new revenue generating opportunities and partnerships across the ASM Global portfolio of offerings.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Include the following.
• Initiates and follows up on various new business opportunities and leads.
• Acquires detailed understanding of business opportunities that present themselves and that track with reaching our strategic plan goals.
• Identifies prospects for privatization opportunities within the industry and develops additional revenue generating concepts with current clients.
• Builds, retains, and leverages local influential parties to aid in the pursuit of contracts and provide local market familiarization.
• Work with key business leaders internally to identify, devise and implement a strategy to maximize ASM resources to generate on-going incremental revenue streams from new business opportunities outside of - but related to - the core business activities of the organization.
• Generate inter-departmental support to ensure that proposals, projects, presentations, sales, and marketing-related correspondence for new business ideas are created, reviewed, and assessed and presented to the President/CEO for further action, if necessary ("due diligence").
• Assist in the development of business plans, pro forma projections, and other relevant business documents (e.g., project feasibility studies, etc.).
• Work across the organization to mobilize relevant business resources (e.g., Finance, Commercial Partnerships, Premium Sales, Marketing) for new and on-going projects.
• Oversee the coordination and implementation of approved new business ideas including, but not limited to, project management, hiring/staffing, and other related responsibilities; for example, reviewing and developing contracts working directly with outside counsel.
• Other duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities
• Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with ASM's policies and applicable laws.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience

Must have B.A., B.S. An M.A., M.S or M.B.A degree preferred. A minimum of 10 years of business experience, preferably with strategic business development background. Proven ability in problem framing, issue identification, and the development of practical business solutions. Advanced quantitative and analytical skills, including the capability to perform market analysis, financial analysis, and complex project feasibility analysis. Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including proficiency in clear, concise, and compelling written communication. Strong interest in understanding and working with operations. Must be willing to travel.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to move around the facility; to stand for long hours during events; talk and hear. This position may require work inside or outside of venues, as needed by events.

Note

The essential responsibilities of this position are described under the headings above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Also, this document in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee occupying this position.

ASM is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer, and encourages Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities, and protected Veterans to apply. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
